Key Arguments: The bill represents significant government overreach and threatens freedom of speech.
The bill lacks transparency and accountability, potentially silencing legitimate free speech.
There is no clear definition of 'harm', allowing unelected bureaucrats to arbitrarily determine truth.
The bill could violate international human rights standards, such as the UN Declaration of Human Rights.
Government content is excluded from the bill's censorship, indicating double standards.
Notable Quotes: Australians value their freedom of speech as it is a hallmark of a healthy democratic society.
This Bill seeks to put way too much power into the hands of unelected bureaucrats who will exert the power to determine what is ‘harm’.
Imagine these great reformers of our time being silenced by such legislation – Martin Luther King and Nelson Mandela.

As a schoolgirl back in 1980 I studied George Orwell’s 1984... I would never have believed I would be writing to object to a Bill up for proposal in Australia in 2023 which contains the most sinister overtones of Orwell’s social science novel.
